Interface FabricApi

Application Fabric APIs (AppFabric)

Please note, these are new API's and will be changed as we evolve them. Please consider these APIs evolutionary.

Properties

accessTokenHeaderKey

accessTokenHeaderKey: string
  • Defined in src/fabric.api.ts:149

Key used when writing the access token in a message header or protocol.

default

'accessToken'.

protocols

protocols: string[]
  • Defined in src/fabric.api.ts:155

Protocols to send to the server during websocket handshake.

default

undefined.

sendAccessTokenDuringHandshake

sendAccessTokenDuringHandshake: boolean
  • Defined in src/fabric.api.ts:163

When true "." will be sent as a sec-websocket-protocol header to the server during the websocket handshake. Useful for non-cookie based authentication implementations.

default

false.

Methods

connect

  • connect(connectHandler: MessageFunction<string>, disconnectHandler: Function, host?: string, port?: number, endpoint?: string, useSSL?: boolean, topicLocation?: string, queueLocation?: string, numRelays?: number, autoReconnect?: boolean): void
    • Defined in src/fabric.api.ts:49

    Connect to fabric endpoint. Defaults to current host and port on '/fabric'

    Parameters

    • connectHandler: MessageFunction<string>

      lambda to fire when the fabric is connected.

    • disconnectHandler: Function

      lambda to fire when the fabric is disconnected.

    • Optional host: string

      hostname of your fabric endpoint, defaults to current host

    • Optional port: number

      port of your fabric endpoint, defaults to current port

    • Optional endpoint: string

      What endpoint are you connecting to? Defaults to /fabric

    • Optional useSSL: boolean

      whether to use secure WebSocket protocol (wss://) instead of ws://

    • Optional topicLocation: string

      What topic location are you subscribing to. /topic by default

    • Optional queueLocation: string

      What queue location are you subscribing to. /queue by default

    • Optional numRelays: number

      how many relays are being used? Defaults to 1.

    • Optional autoReconnect: boolean

      if disconnected, want to auto-reconnect? defaults to true.

    Returns void

    • Defined in src/fabric.api.ts:64

    Disconnect from fabric.

    Parameters

    • Optional connString: string

    Returns void

generateFabricRequest

  • generateFabricRequest<T>(requestCommand: string, payload?: T, headers?: {}): APIRequest<T>
    • Defined in src/fabric.api.ts:95

    Generate a payload designed for fabric services, essentially a shortcut.

    Type parameters

    • T

    Parameters

    • requestCommand: string

      request command to run.

    • Optional payload: T

      to send with request command (optional)

    • Optional headers: {}

      to send with request body (optional)

      • [key: string]: any

    Returns APIRequest<T>

generateFabricResponse

  • generateFabricResponse<T>(id: string, payload: T, error?: boolean, errorCode?: number, errorMessage?: string, version?: number): APIResponse<T>
    • Defined in src/fabric.api.ts:107

    Generate a return payload designed for fabric services, essentially a shortcut. This is generally used for testing, however may come in handy when we experiment with p2p designs.

    Type parameters

    • T

    Parameters

    • id: string

      the UUID response.

    • payload: T

      to send with request command (optional)

    • Optional error: boolean

      optional error boolean

    • Optional errorCode: number

      optional error code

    • Optional errorMessage: string

      optional error message

    • Optional version: number

      optional version number.

    Returns APIResponse<T>

getAccessToken

  • getAccessToken(): string
    • Defined in src/fabric.api.ts:169

    Get access token using getAccessTokenFunction if set else session storage under the key returned by getAccessTokenSessionStorageKey()

    Returns string

getAccessTokenFunction

  • getAccessTokenFunction(): string
    • Defined in src/fabric.api.ts:143

    Function that returns an access token when called. If this is set then this function is used when requesting an access token, else a token is looked for in session storage under the key returned by getAccessTokenSessionStorageKey().

    default

    undefined

    Returns string

getAccessTokenSessionStorageKey

  • getAccessTokenSessionStorageKey(): string
    • Defined in src/fabric.api.ts:135

    Get sessionStorage key for access token. The token will be sent in a galactic call as a header.

    Returns string

getConnectionStateStore

  • getConnectionStateStore(connString?: string): BusStore<FabricConnectionState>
    • Defined in src/fabric.api.ts:78

    Get FabricConnectionState store for the given connection string.

    Parameters

    • Optional connString: string

      connection string of the target broker. if omitted, the bus will try to use the default connection string which is the one, and only one active broker connection in the session. connString needs to be provided always if more than one broker has been connected.

    Returns BusStore<FabricConnectionState>

getFabricVersion

  • getFabricVersion(connString?: string): Observable<string>
    • Defined in src/fabric.api.ts:122

    Get fabric version.

    Parameters

    • Optional connString: string

      connection string of the target broker. if omitted, the bus will try to use the default connection string which is the one, and only one active broker connection in the session. connString needs to be provided always if more than one broker has been connected.

    Returns Observable<string>

    • Defined in src/fabric.api.ts:207

    Switch to using fabric based RestService, no more security issues, un-restricted power!

    Returns void

useLocalRestService

  • useLocalRestService(): void
    • Defined in src/fabric.api.ts:212

    Switch to using local based RestService, engage browser CORS and all the sandbox security you can handle.

    Returns void

whenConnectionStateChanges

  • whenConnectionStateChanges(connString?: string): StoreStream<FabricConnectionState, any>
    • Defined in src/fabric.api.ts:87

    Grab a reference to state stream for connections.

    Parameters

    • Optional connString: string

      connection string of the target broker. if omitted, the bus will try to use the default connection string which is the one, and only one active broker connection in the session. connString needs to be provided always if more than one broker has been connected.

    Returns StoreStream<FabricConnectionState, any>
